Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer's decision to deny a temporary resident visa was procedurally fair and reasonable
Procedural_Context: Judicial review analyzed procedural fairness and factual basis of the visa denial
Credibility_Assessment: Visa officer found applicant likely to remain in Canada for economic opportunities despite claim of visiting a terminally ill relative
Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 2(1)
Basis_of_Claim: Applicant claimed intent to visit a terminally ill relative
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Likelihood of overstaying due to economic opportunities
Review_Outcome: No reviewable error found; decision upheld
Application_Factor: Intent to leave Canada at the end of authorized stay
Authority: Visa officer under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Decision_Review_Issue: Procedural fairness and reasonableness of visa denial
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 2(1)
Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived likelihood of overstaying for economic reasons
Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 2(1)
Evidentiary_Issues: No interview conducted; no extrinsic evidence used
Procedural_Fairness: Not required in this case according to court
Credibility_Issues: Doubt cast on applicant's stated purpose of visit
Procedural_Issue: Lack of interview not a breach of procedural fairness
